==Events==
*[[503 BC]] &ndash; According to the ''[[Fasti Triumphales]]'', [[Roman consul]] [[Agrippa Menenius Lanatus]] celebrated a [[Roman triumph|triumph]] for a military victory over the [[Sabines]].
*[[1147]] &ndash; First historical record of [[Moscow]].
*[[1287]] &ndash; King [[Wareru]] founds [[Hanthawaddy Kingdom|Kingdom of Ramannadesa]], and proclaims independence from [[Pagan Empire]].
*[[1581]] &ndash; [[Francis Drake]] is knighted for completing a circumnavigation of the world.
*[[1660]] &ndash; [[Declaration of Breda]] by King [[Charles II of England]].
*[[1721]] &ndash; Sir [[Robert Walpole]] takes office as the first [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] under [[George I of Great Britain|King George I]].
*[[1768]] &ndash; In [[London]], [[Philip Astley]] stages the first modern [[circus]].
*[[1796]] &ndash; [[Georges Cuvier]] delivers his first [[Paleontology|paleontological]] lecture at École Centrale du Pantheon of the [[Muséum national d'histoire naturelle]] on living and fossil remains of elephants and related species, founding the science of Paleontology. 
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[James Madison]] enacts a ninety-day [[embargo]] on trade with the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon]] abdicates for the first time and names his son [[Napoleon II]] as [[Emperor of the French]].
*[[1818]] &ndash; The [[United States Congress]] adopts the [[flag of the United States]] with 13 red and white stripes and one star for each state (then 20).
*[[1841]] &ndash; [[William Henry Harrison]] dies of [[pneumonia]] becoming the first President of the United States to die in office and with the shortest term served.
*[[1850]] &ndash; The Great Fire of [[Cottenham]]: a large part of the [[Cambridgeshire]] [[village]] ([[England]]) is burnt to the ground in suspicious circumstances.
*  1850   &ndash; [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], is incorporated as a city.
*[[1859]] &ndash; [[Bryant's Minstrels]] debut "[[Dixie (song)|Dixie]]" in [[New York City]] in the finale of a [[blackface]] [[minstrel show]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: A day after [[United States|Union]] forces capture [[Richmond, Virginia]], U.S. President [[Abraham Lincoln]] visits the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] capital.
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[Alexander II of Russia]] narrowly escapes an assassination attempt by [[Dmitry Karakozov]] in the city of [[Saint Petersburg]].
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[The Kennel Club]] is founded, the oldest and first official registry of [[purebred]] [[dog]]s in the world.
*[[1887]] &ndash; [[Argonia, Kansas]] elects [[Susanna M. Salter]] as the first female mayor in the [[United States]].
*[[1905]] &ndash; In [[India]], [[1905 Kangra earthquake|an earthquake]] hits the [[Kangra Valley]], killing 20,000, and destroying most buildings in [[Kangra, Himachal Pradesh|Kangra]], [[Mcleodganj]] and [[Dharamsala, Himachal Pradesh|Dharamshala]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[First Balkan War]]: Greek aviator [[Emmanouil Argyropoulos]] becomes the first pilot to die in the [[Hellenic Air Force]] when his plane crashes.
*[[1930]] &ndash; The [[Communist Party of Panama]] is founded.
*[[1933]] &ndash; U.S. Navy [[airship]], {{USS|Akron|ZRS-4|6}}, is wrecked off the [[New Jersey]] coast due to severe weather.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Faisal II of Iraq|Faisal II]] becomes King of [[Iraq]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Bombing of Bucharest in World War II|First bombardment of oil refineries in Bucharest by Anglo-American forces]] kills 3000 civilians.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: American troops liberate [[Ohrdruf forced labor camp]] in [[Germany]].
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: American troops [[Battle of Kassel (1945)|capture Kassel]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; Twelve nations sign the [[North Atlantic Treaty]] creating the [[NATO|North Atlantic Treaty Organization]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[CND]] [[peace symbol]] is displayed in public for the first time in [[London]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[France]] agrees to grant independence to the [[Mali Federation]], a union of [[Senegal]] and [[French Sudan]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[The Beatles]] occupy the top five positions on the [[Billboard Hot 100]] pop chart.
*[[1965]] &ndash; The first model of the new [[Saab Viggen]] fighter aircraft is unveiled.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Martin Luther King, Jr.]] delivers his "Beyond Vietnam: A Time to Break Silence" speech in [[New York City]]'s [[Riverside Church]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; Martin Luther King, Jr. is assassinated by [[James Earl Ray]] at a motel in [[Memphis, Tennessee]].
*  1968   &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: [[NASA]] launches [[Apollo 6]].
*  1968   &ndash; [[AEK Athens BC]] becomes the first Greek team to win the European Basketball Cup.
*[[1969]] &ndash; Dr. [[Denton Cooley]] implants the first temporary [[artificial heart]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[World Trade Center]] in [[New York City|New York]] is officially dedicated.
*  1973   &ndash; A [[Lockheed C-141 Starlifter]], dubbed the ''[[Hanoi Taxi]]'', makes the last flight of [[Operation Homecoming]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Microsoft]] is founded as a partnership between [[Bill Gates]] and [[Paul Allen]] in [[Albuquerque, New Mexico]]
*  1975   &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[Operation Baby Lift]] &ndash; A [[United States Air Force]] [[Lockheed C-5 Galaxy|Lockheed C-5A Galaxy]] transporting orphans, crashes near [[Saigon]], [[South Vietnam]] shortly after takeoff; 172 die.
*[[1976]] &ndash; Prince [[Norodom Sihanouk]] resigns as leader of [[Cambodia]] and is placed under house arrest.
*[[1979]] &ndash; Prime Minister [[Zulfikar Ali Bhutto]] of [[Pakistan]] is executed.
*[[1981]] &ndash; The [[Islamic Republic of Iran Air Force]] mounts an [[Attack on H3|attack on H-3 Airbase]] and destroys about 50 Iraqi aircraft.
*[[1983]] &ndash; Space Shuttle ''[[Space Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]'' [[STS-6|makes its maiden voyage]] into space.
*[[1984]] &ndash; President [[Ronald Reagan]] calls for an international ban on [[chemical weapon]]s.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[List of Governors of Arizona|Governor]] [[Evan Mecham]] of [[Arizona]] is convicted in his [[impeachment]] trial and removed from office.
*[[1991]] &ndash; Senator [[John Heinz]] of [[Pennsylvania]] and six others are killed when a helicopter collides with their airplane over an elementary school in [[Merion, Pennsylvania]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; The current [[flag of Hong Kong]] is adopted for post-colonial [[Hong Kong]] during the Third Session of the Seventh [[National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China|National People's Congress]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Marc Andreessen]] and [[James H. Clark|Jim Clark]] found [[Netscape Communications Corporation]] under the name "Mosaic Communications Corporation".
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[Comet Hyakutake]] is imaged by the USA Asteroid Orbiter [[Near Earth Asteroid Rendezvous]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; The [[Angola]]n government and [[UNITA]] rebels sign a peace treaty ending the [[Angolan Civil War]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; Fifteen British Royal Navy personnel [[2007 Iranian seizure of Royal Navy personnel|held in Iran]] are released by the Iranian President.
*[[2013]] &ndash; More than 70 people are killed in a [[2013 Thane building collapse|building collapse]] in [[Thane]], [[India]].
